Container.Name: copilot-cli
Container.Overview: GitHub Copilot CLI in a Docker container with persistent authentication. Access the AI-powered command line assistant from your terminal with automatic authentication persistence across container restarts.
Container.Requires:
First time setup: 1. Pull the image from GHCR (automatic when starting container) 2. Access console and run: copilot 3. Use /login command to authenticate (or set GH_TOKEN environment variable)
To change versions: Update COPILOT_VERSION variable and restart container.
Note: Image is pre-built and available on GitHub Container Registry.

Config.Name: Copilot CLI Version
Config.Description: GitHub Copilot CLI version to install (e.g., v0.0.410). Leave as 'latest' for the newest version. Changes take effect on container restart.

Config.Name: Copilot CLI Config
Config.Description: Persistent storage for GitHub Copilot CLI configuration and session data.

Config.Name: GitHub Token (Optional)
Config.Description: GitHub Personal Access Token with 'Copilot Requests' permission for authentication. Optional - can use /login instead.

Config.Name: SSH Keys (Optional)
Config.Description: Optional: Mount your SSH keys directory for Git operations. Leave empty if not needed.

Config.Name: Enable SSH Server
Config.Description: Set to 'true' to enable SSH server for remote access to the container.

Config.Name: SSH Password
Config.Description: Password for SSH access (only used if Enable SSH Server is true). Leave empty to disable password auth.

Config.Name: SSH Port
Config.Description: SSH port for remote access (only needed if Enable SSH Server is true).
